string.text: I could really use some headache pills. That dream didn’t help, either…
Damn it! Another “gift” from the Zone! Just what I needed!
What if I try to use the teleporters? Maybe one of them will lead me to Scavenger?
I need to check out the basement that Marcus talked about. Maybe I’ll find something useful.
Was that thing real or was I just seeing things? I think I’m losing my mind…
An SOS? Strange. Did someone fall into this trap again? I should check it out.
Damn it. Marcus… Where have you gone off to?
Rest in peace, Sledgehammer.
Damn it… This anomaly never fails to surprise me!
Are we finally free from this fucking anomaly?
I should check the arch-anomaly later. Perhaps I might find some valuable artifacts there.
I hate this tunnel!
God damn it. My head is killing me.
Raccoon might be able to help me complete the contract. I should go talk to him.
I should go pay Raccoon a visit. I think he can help me complete the contract.
Other than useless personal notes, the end of this notebook contains coordinates of some kind, written in big, red letters. I should check it out.
What the hell? What am I doing behind bars?
All right, let’s find this Lefty. Where would I go if I’d just killed my friend?
I’ll need to inspect the surroundings when I have some free time.
Damn it. Lefty… Who could have done this? I should search the hangar. Perhaps the murderer left some kind of trace.
Okay… One wrong move on this thing and I’ll fall off…
I gave you a chance to leave peacefully! Now you’ll rot in here for eternity!
Get out of my head!
You won’t break me!
Damn it. This place is swarming with bloodsuckers… I need to stay quiet.
I’ll avenge you, Savage… I’ll make that creature pay for everything!
I need to blow the entrance shut so that creature won’t follow me out.
Farewell, Hermit.

During the afternoon, Hunter and I went on our way, and after a few hours, we were already in the bar. By the time we got there, it was already dark, so Hunter suggested we get some rest and head off to the Cordon next thing in the morning. The story’s not over yet, though…

Alas, I wake up not in the bar but in the Lair. In front of me, I see a panicked Marcus, and with each moment, my memories of the past slowly fade away. Stronglav won’t release me from his net so easily. He’s playing with me, keeping me trapped inside some kind of time loop, restarting it over and over. Unfortunately, I won’t be able to remember how I got out of here previously; my memories fade away with a headache. I cannot leave this time loop while the creature is alive, but I will find a way. I promise!

I don’t know what happened after my conversation with Marcus, but when I come to, I find myself in the Lair. In front of me, I see a panicked Marcus, and with each moment, my memories of the digger station and the Outpost fade away. Stronglav won’t release me from his net so easily. He needs me—or rather, my body—and he’s keeping me trapped inside some kind of time loop, restarting it over and over, until I give in. But I won’t give in, and I will find a way to kill that creature. I promise!

Listen up, Mosquito: take Beast with you and hurry on over to the zombies. We need to eliminate them at all costs, or they’ll overrun the base in minutes. Use all the ammo you have left—Beast has supplied us with additional magazines. I hope you both pull this off.
Beast, can you hear me? I’ll try to talk to the base leader. He should free you. Just don’t do anything stupid in the meantime. See you later.
Are you ready? Then take the lead while I cover you from behind.
I think that’s the last of them. Check the bodies; we need everything we can get right now.
C—C—Controller… C—Careful…
Uh-huh. The chimera’s in the bunker… Don’t let it get out of the bunker, or we’re dead meat. If it does come out in the open, I’ll provide fire support. Go!
A living soul… So I’ve made it. The emission won’t get me here. Hey, merc, grab that bottle on the table. Let’s drink to the fact that we’ve lived through another day.
Be careful…
Step back!
Okay. This trail is fresh. Means the doggy’s somewhere nearby… Merc, look sharp. Unless, of course, you want to become lunch.
Thanks for freeing us, man.
I said come in. Don’t stand there.
Merc, I take it you’re the leader here? Put down your weapons. We just want to talk… for now.
Our squad is ready for action. Waiting for your signal!
Attention! We’ve been detected!
Let’s do this, boys!
’Ey, what do you want? It’s the middle of the night…
Ugh, these people… Go on, then!
Bromine, take out one of them.
Shoot. I’m not afraid of death…
Good morning to you, Animal. How did you sleep? You’ll have to excuse me, but the time has come for us to say goodbye. Give my regards to our men on the other side.
So, Savage told me the transformer should be somewhere around here. Wait a bit. I’ll try to open this lock.
Okay. Continue on your own. I think you know what a transformer box looks like. Just turn the switch and get back.
Merc, step up to the door. Got a word with you.
Hey, merc, what brings you here? Come over and we’ll talk.

Yo, boys, listen up… You ain’t all dead over there, are you?… Come on! Get on the air already! Hey, brothers, we ain’t clear on what’s going on! Our homies are laying low. Gotta take a peek and see what’s up.\n— Don’t worry, boss. We’re going.
Come on in, merc. Miklukha’s waiting for you.
Get out of my face. Go bother Ratter, not me.
Merc, you won’t stop him. Just accept the reality of things and stop resisting.
Let him consume you.
Hi, Semyon. Listen, you haven’t seen Markus, have you?
Hi, Snakecatcher. As far as I know, he went to the cages. Seems like he’s still there.
Okay, merc, the cages are down the hall to the left. That door over there in the laboratory will lead you to them. Don’t get lost there.
Semyon, let him through.
I need to start the transmitter outside the spatial anomaly, not here.
I’ve already sent the coordinates to the anomaly exit. No need to do it again.
